experiment: F-ECO5 heat tracker archive blindness bug
hypothesis: _get_domain_heat() only reading SWARM-LANES.md (not archive) causes high-visit domains to be misclassified as NEW, receiving +13 undeserved boost that amplifies exploitation
method: Compared heat classifications before/after fixing _get_domain_heat() to read both LANES_FILE and LANES_ARCHIVE with full domain resolution (DOMEX prefix + COUNCIL topic + focus= fallback). Measured score deltas for top-visit domains.

fix.domain_resolution: DOMEX lane prefix + COUNCIL topic mapping + focus= fallback (same as _get_domain_outcomes)

root_cause: Feature asymmetry: _get_domain_outcomes() reads both files with 3-tier domain resolution; _get_domain_heat() read 1 file with 1-tier resolution. Same class as L-556 (stale baseline), L-510 (regex), L-530 (field parser): state growth outpaces tool assumptions.
verdict: CONFIRMED: heat tracker archive blindness caused exploitation amplification. 30+ domains misclassified. Fix aligns heat/outcome domain resolution. Concurrent session's score Gini measurements were partially contaminated by this bug.
iso: ISO-13 (integral windup â€” heat tracker accumulated an ever-growing gap between its state model and reality as archive grew)
